oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of a ration change from a total mixed ration to pasture on production, health and rumen physiology of dairy cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sch√§ren, M.
Dieho, K.
Seyfang, G.
Dijkstra, J.
Meyer, U.
Breves, G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In temperate climate zones dairy cows need to be fed with conserved feed during winter, and are then often gradually transitioned to a pasture-based ration in spring. We hypothesized that the change from a confinement to a pasture-based system involves complex nutritional and metabolic adaptations with consequences on health and performance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2016; 183
